00052 #define victorate(TYPE, VARIABLE, ITERATOR)                        \
00053   std::vector<TYPE>::const_iterator ITERATOR = (VARIABLE).begin(); \
00054   for(; (ITERATOR) != (VARIABLE).end(); (ITERATOR)++)

00299     std::string  __double2string(const double& Value) const {
00300         // -- converts a double integer into a string
00301         char* tmp = new char[128];
00302 #ifdef WIN32
00303         _snprintf(tmp, (int)sizeof(char)*128, "%e", Value);
00304 #else
00305         snprintf(tmp, (int)sizeof(char)*128, "%e", Value);
00306 #endif
00307         std::string result(tmp);
00308         delete [] tmp;
00309         return result;
00310     }
00311 
00312     std::string  __int2string(const int& Value) const {
00313         // -- converts an integer into a string
00314         char* tmp = new char[128];
00315 #ifdef WIN32
00316         _snprintf(tmp, (int)sizeof(char)*128, "%i", Value);
00317 #else
00318         snprintf(tmp, (int)sizeof(char)*128, "%i", Value);
00319 #endif
00320         std::string result(tmp);
00321         delete [] tmp;
00322         return result;
00323     }
00324 
00325     STRING_VECTOR __get_section_tree(const std::string& FullPath) {
00326         // -- cuts a variable name into a tree of sub-sections. this is requested for recording
00327         //    requested sections when dealing with 'ufo' detection.
00328         STRING_VECTOR   result;
00329         const char* Start = FullPath.c_str();
00330 
00331         for(char *p = (char*)Start; *p ; p++) {
00332             if( *p == '/' ) { 
00333                 *p = '\0';  // set terminating zero for convinience
00334                 const std::string Section = Start;
00335                 *p = '/';   // reset slash at place
00336                 result.push_back(Section);
00337             }
00338         }
00339 
00340         return result;
00341     }
00342 };

00349 inline void
00350 GetPot::__basic_initialization()
00351 {
00352     cursor = 0;              nominus_cursor = -1;
00353     search_failed_f = true;  search_loop_f = true;
00354     prefix = "";             section = "";
00355     
00356     // automatic request recording for later ufo detection
00357     request_recording_f = true;
00358 
00359     // comment start and end strings
00360     _comment_start = std::string("#");
00361     _comment_end   = std::string("\n");
00362 
00363     // default: separate vector elements by whitespaces
00364     _field_separator = " \t\n";
00365 }
00366 
00367 inline
00368 GetPot::GetPot() 
00369 { 
00370     __basic_initialization(); 
00371 
00372     STRING_VECTOR _apriori_argv;
00373     _apriori_argv.push_back(std::string("Empty"));
00374     __parse_argument_vector(_apriori_argv);
00375 }
00376 
00377 inline
00378 GetPot::GetPot(const int argc_, char ** argv_, 
00379                const char* FieldSeparator /* =0x0 */)     
00380     // leave 'char**' non-const to honor less capable compilers ... 
00381 {
00382     __basic_initialization();
00383 
00384     // if specified -> overwrite default string
00385     if( FieldSeparator ) _field_separator = std::string(FieldSeparator);
00386 
00387     // -- make an internal copy of the argument list:
00388     STRING_VECTOR _apriori_argv;
00389     // -- for the sake of clarity: we do want to include the first argument in the argument vector !
00390     //    it will not be a nominus argument, though. This gives us a minimun vector size of one
00391     //    which facilitates error checking in many functions. Also the user will be able to
00392     //    retrieve the name of his application by "get[0]"
00393     _apriori_argv.push_back(std::string(argv_[0]));
00394     int i=1;
00395     for(; i<argc_; i++) {
00396         std::string tmp(argv_[i]);   // recall the problem with temporaries,
00397         _apriori_argv.push_back(tmp);       // reference counting in arguement lists ...
00398     }
00399     __parse_argument_vector(_apriori_argv);
00400 }
00401 
00402 
00403 inline
00404 GetPot::GetPot(const char* FileName,
00405                const char* CommentStart  /* = 0x0 */, const char* CommentEnd /* = 0x0 */,
00406                const char* FieldSeparator/* = 0x0 */)     
00407 {
00408     __basic_initialization();
00409 
00410     // if specified -> overwrite default strings
00411     if( CommentStart )   _comment_start = std::string(CommentStart);
00412     if( CommentEnd )     _comment_end   = std::string(CommentEnd);
00413     if( FieldSeparator ) _field_separator = FieldSeparator;
00414     
00415     STRING_VECTOR _apriori_argv;
00416     // -- file name is element of argument vector, however, it is not parsed for
00417     //    variable assignments or nominuses.
00418     _apriori_argv.push_back(std::string(FileName));
00419 
00420     STRING_VECTOR args = __read_in_file(FileName);
00421     _apriori_argv.insert(_apriori_argv.begin()+1, args.begin(), args.end());
00422     __parse_argument_vector(_apriori_argv);
00423 }

00429 inline
00430 GetPot::~GetPot()

00434         delete [] *it;  
00435 }

00437 inline GetPot&
00438 GetPot::operator=(const GetPot& That)
00439 {
00440     if (&That == this) return *this;
00441 
00442     _comment_start  = That._comment_start;
00443     _comment_end    = That._comment_end;
00444     argv            = That.argv;
00445     variables       = That.variables;
00446     prefix          = That.prefix;
00447 
00448     cursor          = That.cursor;
00449     nominus_cursor  = That.nominus_cursor;
00450     search_failed_f = That.search_failed_f;
00451 
00452     idx_nominus     = That.idx_nominus;
00453     search_loop_f   = That.search_loop_f;
00454 
00455     return *this;
00456 }

00459 inline void
00460 GetPot::absorb(const GetPot& That)
00461 {
00462     if (&That == this) return;
00463 
00464     STRING_VECTOR  __tmp(That.argv);
00465 
00466     __tmp.erase(__tmp.begin());
00467 
00468     __parse_argument_vector(__tmp);
00469 }
00470 
00471 inline void    
00472 GetPot::clear_requests()
00473 {
00474     _requested_arguments.erase(_requested_arguments.begin(), _requested_arguments.end());
00475     _requested_variables.erase(_requested_variables.begin(), _requested_variables.end());
00476     _requested_sections.erase(_requested_sections.begin(), _requested_sections.end());
00477 }
00478 
00479 inline void
00480 GetPot::__parse_argument_vector(const STRING_VECTOR& ARGV)
00481 {
00482     if( ARGV.size() == 0 ) return;
00483 
00484     // build internal databases:
00485     //   1) array with no-minus arguments (usually used as filenames)
00486     //   2) variable assignments:
00487     //             'variable name' '=' number | string
00488     STRING_VECTOR                 section_stack;
00489     STRING_VECTOR::const_iterator it = ARGV.begin();
00490 
00491 
00492     section = "";
00493 
00494     // -- do not parse the first argument, so that it is not interpreted a s a nominus or so.
00495     argv.push_back(*it);
00496     it++;
00497 
00498     // -- loop over remaining arguments
00499     unsigned i=1;
00500     for(; it != ARGV.end(); it++, i++) {
00501         std::string arg = *it;
00502 
00503         if( arg.length() == 0 ) continue;
00504 
00505         // -- [section] labels
00506         if( arg.length() > 1 && arg[0] == '[' && arg[arg.length()-1] == ']' ) {
00507 
00508             // (*) sections are considered 'requested arguments'
00509             if( request_recording_f ) _requested_arguments.push_back(arg);
00510             
00511             const std::string Name = __DBE_expand_string(arg.substr(1, arg.length()-2));
00512             section = __process_section_label(Name, section_stack);
00513             // new section --> append to list of sections
00514             if( find(section_list.begin(), section_list.end(), section) == section_list.end() )
00515                 if( section.length() != 0 ) section_list.push_back(section);
00516             argv.push_back(arg);
00517         }
00518         else {
00519             arg = section + __DBE_expand_string(arg);
00520             argv.push_back(arg);
00521         }
00522 
00523         // -- separate array for nominus arguments
00524         if( arg[0] != '-' ) idx_nominus.push_back(unsigned(i));
00525 
00526         // -- variables: does arg contain a '=' operator ?
00527         const char* p = arg.c_str();
00528         for(; *p ; p++) {
00529             if( *p == '=' ) {
00530                 // (*) record for later ufo detection
00531                 //     arguments carriying variables are always treated as 'requested' arguments. 
00532                 //     unrequested variables have to be detected with the ufo-variable
00533                 //     detection routine.
00534                 if( request_recording_f ) _requested_arguments.push_back(arg);
00535 
00536                 // set terminating 'zero' to treat first part as single string
00537                 // => arg (from start to 'p') = Name of variable
00538                 //    p+1     (until terminating zero) = value of variable
00539                 char* o = (char*)p++;
00540                 *o = '\0';                       // set temporary terminating zero
00541                 __set_variable(arg.c_str(), p);  // v-name = c_str() bis 'p', value = rest
00542                 *o = '=';                        // reset the original '='
00543                 break;
00544             }
00545         }
00546     }
00547 }
00548 
00549 
00550 inline STRING_VECTOR
00551 GetPot::__read_in_file(const char* FileName)
00552 {
00553     std::ifstream  i(FileName);
00554     if( ! i ) return STRING_VECTOR();
00555     // argv[0] == the filename of the file that was read in
00556     return __read_in_stream(i);
00557 }
00558 
00559 inline STRING_VECTOR
00560 GetPot::__read_in_stream(std::istream& istr)
00561 {
00562     STRING_VECTOR  brute_tokens;
00563     while(istr) {
00564         __skip_whitespace(istr);
00565         const std::string Token = __get_next_token(istr);
00566         if( Token.length() == 0 || Token[0] == EOF) break;
00567         brute_tokens.push_back(Token);
00568     }
00569 
00570     // -- reduce expressions of token1'='token2 to a single
00571     //    string 'token1=token2'
00572     // -- copy everything into 'argv'
00573     // -- arguments preceded by something like '[' name ']' (section)
00574     //    produce a second copy of each argument with a prefix '[name]argument'
00575     unsigned i1 = 0;
00576     unsigned i2 = 1;
00577     unsigned i3 = 2;
00578 
00579     STRING_VECTOR  arglist;
00580     while( i1 < brute_tokens.size() ) {
00581         const std::string& SRef = brute_tokens[i1];
00582         // 1) concatinate 'abcdef' '=' 'efgasdef' to 'abcdef=efgasdef'
00583         // note: java.lang.String: substring(a,b) = from a to b-1
00584         //        C++ string:      substr(a,b)    = from a to a + b
00585         if( i2 < brute_tokens.size() && brute_tokens[i2] == "=" ) {
00586             if( i3 >= brute_tokens.size() )
00587                 arglist.push_back(brute_tokens[i1] + brute_tokens[i2]);
00588             else
00589                 arglist.push_back(brute_tokens[i1] + brute_tokens[i2] + brute_tokens[i3]);
00590             i1 = i3+1; i2 = i3+2; i3 = i3+3;
00591             continue;
00592         }
00593         else {
00594             arglist.push_back(SRef);
00595             i1=i2; i2=i3; i3++;
00596         }
00597     }
00598     return arglist;
00599 }
00600 
00601 inline void
00602 GetPot::__skip_whitespace(std::istream& istr)
00603     // find next non-whitespace while deleting comments
00604 {
00605     int tmp = istr.get();
00606     do {
00607         // -- search a non whitespace
00608         while( isspace(tmp) ) {
00609             tmp = istr.get();
00610             if( ! istr ) return;
00611         }
00612 
00613         // -- look if characters match the comment starter string
00614         const std::istream::pos_type  Pos = istr.tellg();
00615         unsigned    i=0;
00616         for(; i<_comment_start.length() ; i++) {
00617             if( tmp != _comment_start[i] ) { 
00618                 istr.seekg(Pos);
00619                 // -- one step more backwards, since 'tmp' already at non-whitespace
00620                 istr.unget();
00621                 return; 
00622             }
00623             tmp = istr.get();
00624             if( ! istr ) { istr.unget(); return; }
00625         }
00626         // 'tmp' contains last character of _comment_starter
00627 
00628         // -- comment starter found -> search for comment ender
00629         unsigned match_no=0;
00630         while(1+1 == 2) {
00631             tmp = istr.get();
00632             if( ! istr ) { istr.unget(); return; }
00633 
00634             if( tmp == _comment_end[match_no] ) { 
00635                 match_no++;
00636                 if( match_no == _comment_end.length() ) {
00637                     istr.unget();
00638                     break; // shuffle more whitespace, end of comment found
00639                 }
00640             }
00641             else
00642                 match_no = 0;
00643         }
00644 
00645         tmp = istr.get();
00646 
00647     } while( istr );
00648     istr.unget();
00649 }
00650 
00651 inline const std::string
00652 GetPot::__get_next_token(std::istream& istr)
00653     // get next concatinates string token. consider quotes that embrace
00654     // whitespaces
00655 {
00656     std::string token;
00657     int    tmp = 0;
00658     int    last_letter = 0;
00659     while(1+1 == 2) {
00660         last_letter = tmp; tmp = istr.get();
00661         if( tmp == EOF
00662             || ((tmp == ' ' || tmp == '\t' || tmp == '\n') && last_letter != '\\') ) {
00663             return token;
00664         }
00665         else if( tmp == '\'' && last_letter != '\\' ) {
00666             // QUOTES: un-backslashed quotes => it's a string
00667             token += __get_string(istr);
00668             continue;
00669         }
00670         else if( tmp == '{' && last_letter == '$') {
00671             token += '{' + __get_until_closing_bracket(istr);
00672             continue;
00673         }
00674         else if( tmp == '$' && last_letter == '\\') {
00675             token += tmp; tmp = 0;  //  so that last_letter will become = 0, not '$';
00676             continue;
00677         }
00678         else if( tmp == '\\' && last_letter != '\\')
00679             continue;              // don't append un-backslashed backslashes
00680         token += tmp;
00681     }
00682 }
00683 
00684 inline const std::string
00685 GetPot::__get_string(std::istream& istr)
00686     // parse input until next matching '
00687 {
00688     std::string str;
00689     int    tmp = 0;
00690     int    last_letter = 0;
00691     while(1 + 1 == 2) {
00692         last_letter = tmp; tmp = istr.get();
00693         if( tmp == EOF)  return str;
00694         // un-backslashed quotes => it's the end of the string
00695         else if( tmp == '\'' && last_letter != '\\')  return str;
00696         else if( tmp == '\\' && last_letter != '\\')  continue; // don't append
00697 
00698         str += tmp;
00699     }
00700 }
00701 
00702 inline const std::string
00703 GetPot::__get_until_closing_bracket(std::istream& istr)
00704     // parse input until next matching }
00705 {
00706     std::string str = "";
00707     int    tmp = 0;
00708     int    last_letter = 0;
00709     int    brackets = 1;
00710     while(1 + 1 == 2) {
00711         last_letter = tmp; tmp = istr.get();
00712         if( tmp == EOF) return str;
00713         else if( tmp == '{' && last_letter == '$') brackets += 1;
00714         else if( tmp == '}') {
00715             brackets -= 1;
00716             // un-backslashed brackets => it's the end of the string
00717             if( brackets == 0) return str + '}';
00718             else if( tmp == '\\' && last_letter != '\\')
00719                 continue;  // do not append an unbackslashed backslash
00720         }
00721         str += tmp;
00722     }
00723 }
00724 
00725 inline std::string
00726 GetPot::__process_section_label(const std::string& Section,
00727                                 STRING_VECTOR& section_stack)
00728 {
00729     std::string sname = Section;
00730     //  1) subsection of actual section ('./' prefix)
00731     if( sname.length() >= 2 && sname.substr(0, 2) == "./" ) {
00732         sname = sname.substr(2);
00733     }
00734     //  2) subsection of parent section ('../' prefix)
00735     else if( sname.length() >= 3 && sname.substr(0, 3) == "../" ) {
00736         do {
00737             if( section_stack.end() != section_stack.begin() )
00738                 section_stack.pop_back();
00739             sname = sname.substr(3);
00740         } while( sname.substr(0, 3) == "../" );
00741     }
00742     // 3) subsection of the root-section
00743     else {
00744         section_stack.erase(section_stack.begin(), section_stack.end());
00745         // [] => back to root section
00746     }
00747 
00748     if( sname != "" ) {
00749         // parse section name for 'slashes'
00750         unsigned i=0;
00751         while( i < sname.length() ) {
00752             if( sname[i] == '/' ) {
00753                 section_stack.push_back(sname.substr(0,i));
00754                 if( i+1 < sname.length()-1 )
00755                     sname = sname.substr(i+1);
00756                 i = 0;
00757             }
00758             else
00759                 i++;
00760         }
00761         section_stack.push_back(sname);
00762     }
00763     std::string sectionstring = "";
00764     if( section_stack.size() != 0 ) {
00765         victorate(std::string, section_stack, it)
00766             sectionstring += *it + "/";
00767     }
00768     return sectionstring;
00769 }
00770 
00771 
00772 // convert string to DOUBLE, if not possible return Default
00773 inline double
00774 GetPot::__convert_to_type(const std::string& String, double Default) const
00775 {
00776     double tmp;
00777     if( sscanf(String.c_str(),"%lf", &tmp) != 1 ) return Default;
00778     return tmp;
00779 }
00780 
00781 // convert string to INT, if not possible return Default
00782 inline int
00783 GetPot::__convert_to_type(const std::string& String, int Default) const
00784 {
00785     int tmp;
00786     if( sscanf(String.c_str(),"%i", &tmp) != 1 ) return Default;
00787     return tmp;
00788 }
00789 
00791 // (*) cursor oriented functions
00792 //.............................................................................
00793 inline const std::string
00794 GetPot::__get_remaining_string(const std::string& String, const std::string& Start) const
00795     // Checks if 'String' begins with 'Start' and returns the remaining String.
00796     // Returns None if String does not begin with Start.
00797 {
00798     if( Start == "" ) return String;
00799     // note: java.lang.String: substring(a,b) = from a to b-1
00800     //        C++ string:      substr(a,b)    = from a to a + b
00801     if( String.find(Start) == 0 ) return String.substr(Start.length());
00802     else                          return "";
00803 }
00804 
00805 //     -- search for a certain argument and set cursor to position
00806 inline bool
00807 GetPot::search(const char* Option)
00808 {    
00809     unsigned           OldCursor = cursor;
00810     const std::string  SearchTerm = prefix + Option;
00811 
00812     // (*) record requested arguments for later ufo detection
00813     __record_argument_request(SearchTerm);                             
00814 
00815     if( OldCursor >= argv.size() ) OldCursor = argv.size() - 1;
00816     search_failed_f = true;
00817 
00818     // (*) first loop from cursor position until end
00819     unsigned  c = cursor;
00820     for(; c < argv.size(); c++) {
00821         if( argv[c] == SearchTerm )
00822         { cursor = c; search_failed_f = false; return true; }
00823     }
00824     if( ! search_loop_f ) return false;
00825 
00826     // (*) second loop from 0 to old cursor position
00827     for(c = 1; c < OldCursor; c++) {
00828         if( argv[c] == SearchTerm )
00829         { cursor = c; search_failed_f = false; return true; }
00830     }
00831     // in case nothing is found the cursor stays where it was
00832     return false;
00833 }
00834 
00835 
00836 inline bool
00837 GetPot::search(unsigned No, const char* P, ...)
00838 {
00839     // (*) recording the requested arguments happens in subroutine 'search'
00840     if( No == 0 ) return false;
00841 
00842     // search for the first argument
00843     if( search(P) == true ) return true;
00844 
00845     // start interpreting variable argument list
00846     va_list ap;
00847     va_start(ap, P);
00848     unsigned i = 1;
00849     for(; i < No; i++) {
00850         char* Opt = va_arg(ap, char *);
00851         if( search(Opt) == true ) break;
00852     }
00853     
00854     if( i < No ) {
00855         i++;
00856         // loop was left before end of array --> hit but 
00857         // make sure that the rest of the search terms is marked
00858         // as requested.
00859         for(; i < No; i++) {
00860             char* Opt = va_arg(ap, char *);
00861             // (*) record requested arguments for later ufo detection
00862             __record_argument_request(Opt);
00863         }
00864         va_end(ap);
00865         return true;
00866     }
00867 
00868     va_end(ap);
00869     // loop was left normally --> no hit
00870     return false;
00871 }

00874 GetPot::reset_cursor()
00875 { search_failed_f = false; cursor = 0; }

00878 GetPot::init_multiple_occurrence()
00879 { disable_loop(); reset_cursor(); }

00914 //     -- next() function group
00915 inline int
00916 GetPot::next(int Default)
00917 {
00918     if( search_failed_f ) return Default;
00919     cursor++;
00920     if( cursor >= argv.size() )  
00921     { cursor = argv.size(); return Default; }
00922 
00923     // (*) record requested argument for later ufo detection
00924     __record_argument_request(argv[cursor]);
00925 
00926     const std::string Remain = __get_remaining_string(argv[cursor], prefix);
00927 
00928     return Remain != "" ? __convert_to_type(Remain, Default) : Default;
00929 }
00930 
00931 inline double
00932 GetPot::next(const double& Default)
00933 {
00934     if( search_failed_f ) return Default;
00935     cursor++;
00936 
00937     if( cursor >= argv.size() )
00938     { cursor = argv.size(); return Default; }
00939 
00940     // (*) record requested argument for later ufo detection
00941     __record_argument_request(argv[cursor]);
00942 
00943     std::string Remain = __get_remaining_string(argv[cursor], prefix);
00944 
00945     return Remain != "" ? __convert_to_type(Remain, Default) : Default;
00946 }
00947 
00948 inline const char*
00949 GetPot::next(const char* Default)
00950 {
00951     if( search_failed_f ) return Default;
00952     cursor++;
00953 
00954     if( cursor >= argv.size() )
00955     { cursor = argv.size(); return Default; }
00956 
00957     // (*) record requested argument for later ufo detection
00958     __record_argument_request(argv[cursor]);
00959 
00960     const std::string Remain = __get_remaining_string(argv[cursor], prefix);
00961 
00962     if( Remain == "" ) return Default;
00963 
00964 
00965     // (*) function returns a pointer to a char array (inside Remain)
00966     //     this array will be deleted, though after this function call.
00967     //     To ensure propper functioning, create a copy inside *this
00968     //     object and only delete it, when *this is deleted.
00969     char* result = new char[Remain.length()+1];
00970     strncpy(result, Remain.c_str(), Remain.length()+1);
00971 
00972     // store the created string internally, delete if when object deleted
00973     __internal_string_container.push_back(result);
00974 
00975     return result;
00976 }

00978 //     -- follow() function group
00979 //        distinct option to be searched for
00980 inline int
00981 GetPot::follow(int Default, const char* Option)
00982 {
00983     // (*) record requested of argument is entirely handled in 'search()' and 'next()'
00984     if( search(Option) == false ) return Default;
00985     return next(Default);
00986 }

00988 inline double
00989 GetPot::follow(const double& Default, const char* Option)
00990 {
00991     // (*) record requested of argument is entirely handled in 'search()' and 'next()'
00992     if( search(Option) == false ) return Default;
00993     return next(Default);
00994 }

00996 inline const char*
00997 GetPot::follow(const char* Default, const char* Option)
00998 {
00999     // (*) record requested of argument is entirely handled in 'search()' and 'next()'
01000     if( search(Option) == false ) return Default;
01001     return next(Default);
01002 }
01003 
01004 //     -- second follow() function group
01005 //        multiple option to be searched for
01006 inline int
01007 GetPot::follow(int Default, unsigned No, const char* P, ...)
01008 {
01009     // (*) record requested of argument is entirely handled in 'search()' and 'next()'
01010     if( No == 0 ) return Default;
01011     if( search(P) == true ) return next(Default);
01012 
01013     va_list ap;
01014     va_start(ap, P);
01015     unsigned i=1;
01016     for(; i<No; i++) {
01017         char* Opt = va_arg(ap, char *);
01018         if( search(Opt) == true ) {
01019             va_end(ap);
01020             return next(Default);
01021         }
01022     }
01023     va_end(ap);
01024     return Default;
01025 }
01026 
01027 inline double
01028 GetPot::follow(const double& Default, unsigned No, const char* P, ...)
01029 {
01030     // (*) record requested of argument is entirely handled in 'search()' and 'next()'
01031     if( No == 0 ) return Default;
01032     if( search(P) == true ) return next(Default);
01033 
01034     va_list ap;
01035     va_start(ap, P);
01036     for(unsigned i=1; i<No; i++) {
01037         char* Opt = va_arg(ap, char *);
01038         if( search(Opt) == true ) {
01039             va_end(ap);
01040             return next(Default);
01041         }
01042     }
01043     va_end(ap);
01044     return Default;
01045 }
01046 
01047 inline const char*
01048 GetPot::follow(const char* Default, unsigned No, const char* P, ...)
01049 {
01050     // (*) record requested of argument is entirely handled in 'search()' and 'next()'
01051     if( No == 0 ) return Default;
01052     if( search(P) == true ) return next(Default);
01053 
01054     va_list ap;
01055     va_start(ap, P);
01056     unsigned i=1;
01057     for(; i<No; i++) {
01058         char* Opt = va_arg(ap, char *);
01059         if( search(Opt) == true ) {
01060             va_end(ap);
01061             return next(Default);
01062         }
01063     }
01064     va_end(ap);
01065     return Default;
01066 }
01068 // (*) directly connected options
01069 //.............................................................................
01070 //
01071 inline int
01072 GetPot::direct_follow(int Default, const char* Option)
01073 {
01074     const char* FollowStr = __match_starting_string(Option);
01075 
01076     // (*) record requested of argument for later ufo-detection
01077     __record_argument_request(std::string(Option) + FollowStr);
01078 
01079     if( FollowStr == 0 )                    return Default;
01080     if( ++cursor >= argv.size() ) cursor = argv.size();
01081     return __convert_to_type(FollowStr, Default);
01082 }
01083 
01084 inline double
01085 GetPot::direct_follow(const double& Default, const char* Option)
01086 {
01087     const char* FollowStr = __match_starting_string(Option);
01088 
01089     // (*) record requested of argument for later ufo-detection
01090     __record_argument_request(std::string(Option) + FollowStr);
01091 
01092     if( FollowStr == 0 )                   return Default;
01093     if( ++cursor >= argv.size() ) cursor = argv.size();
01094     return __convert_to_type(FollowStr, Default);
01095 }
01096 
01097 inline const char*
01098 GetPot::direct_follow(const char* Default, const char* Option)
01099 {
01100     if( search_failed_f ) return Default;
01101     const char* FollowStr = __match_starting_string(Option);
01102 
01103     // (*) record requested of argument for later ufo-detection
01104     __record_argument_request(std::string(Option) + FollowStr);
01105 
01106     if( FollowStr == 0 )          return Default;
01107     if( ++cursor >= argv.size() ) cursor = argv.size();
01108     return FollowStr;
01109 }
01110 
01111 inline const char*
01112 GetPot::__match_starting_string(const char* StartString)
01113     // pointer  to the place where the string after
01114     //          the match inside the found argument starts.
01115     // 0        no argument matches the starting string.
01116 {
01117     const unsigned N         = strlen(StartString);
01118     unsigned       OldCursor = cursor;
01119 
01120     if( OldCursor >= argv.size() ) OldCursor = argv.size() - 1;
01121     search_failed_f = true;
01122 
01123     // (*) first loop from cursor position until end
01124     unsigned c = cursor;
01125     for(; c < argv.size(); c++) {
01126         if( strncmp(StartString, argv[c].c_str(), N) == 0)
01127         { cursor = c; search_failed_f = false; return &(argv[c].c_str()[N]); }
01128     }
01129 
01130     if( ! search_loop_f ) return false;
01131 
01132     // (*) second loop from 0 to old cursor position
01133     for(c = 1; c < OldCursor; c++) {
01134         if( strncmp(StartString, argv[c].c_str(), N) == 0)
01135         { cursor = c; search_failed_f = false; return &(argv[c].c_str()[N]); }
01136     }
01137     return 0;
01138 }
01139 
01141 // (*) search for flags
01142 //.............................................................................
01143 //
01144 inline bool
01145 GetPot::options_contain(const char* FlagList) const
01146 {
01147     // go through all arguments that start with a '-' (but not '--')
01148     std::string str;
01149     STRING_VECTOR::const_iterator it = argv.begin();
01150     for(; it != argv.end(); it++) {
01151         str = __get_remaining_string(*it, prefix);
01152 
01153         if( str.length() >= 2 && str[0] == '-' && str[1] != '-' )
01154             if( __check_flags(str, FlagList) ) return true;
01155     }
01156     return false;
01157 }
01158 
01159 inline bool
01160 GetPot::argument_contains(unsigned Idx, const char* FlagList) const
01161 {
01162     if( Idx >= argv.size() ) return false;
01163 
01164     // (*) record requested of argument for later ufo-detection
01165     //     an argument that is checked for flags is considered to be 'requested'
01166     ((GetPot*)this)->__record_argument_request(argv[Idx]);
01167 
01168     if( prefix == "" )
01169         // search argument for any flag in flag list
01170         return __check_flags(argv[Idx], FlagList);
01171 
01172     // if a prefix is set, then the argument index is the index
01173     //   inside the 'namespace'
01174     // => only check list of arguments that start with prefix
01175     unsigned no_matches = 0;
01176     unsigned i=0;
01177     for(; i<argv.size(); i++) {
01178         const std::string Remain = __get_remaining_string(argv[i], prefix);
01179         if( Remain != "") {
01180             no_matches += 1;
01181             if( no_matches == Idx)
01182                 return __check_flags(Remain, FlagList);
01183         }
01184     }
01185     // no argument in this namespace
01186     return false;
01187 }
01188 
01189 inline bool
01190 GetPot::__check_flags(const std::string& Str, const char* FlagList) const
01191 {
01192     const char* p=FlagList;
01193     for(; *p != '\0' ; p++)
01194         if( Str.find(*p) != std::string::npos ) return true; // found something
01195     return false;
01196 }
01197 
01199 // (*) nominus arguments
01200 inline STRING_VECTOR
01201 GetPot::nominus_vector() const
01202     // return vector of nominus arguments
01203 {
01204     STRING_VECTOR nv;
01205     std::vector<unsigned>::const_iterator it = idx_nominus.begin();
01206     for(; it != idx_nominus.end(); it++) {
01207         nv.push_back(argv[*it]);
01208 
01209         // (*) record for later ufo-detection
01210         //     when a nominus vector is requested, the entire set of nominus arguments are 
01211         //     tagged as 'requested'
01212         ((GetPot*)this)->__record_argument_request(argv[*it]);
01213     }
01214     return nv;
01215 }
01216 
01217 inline const char*
01218 GetPot::next_nominus()
01219 {
01220     if( nominus_cursor < int(idx_nominus.size()) - 1 ) {
01221         const std::string Tmp = argv[idx_nominus[++nominus_cursor]];
01222 
01223         // (*) record for later ufo-detection
01224         __record_argument_request(Tmp);
01225 
01226         return Tmp.c_str();
01227     }
01228     return 0;
01229 }
01230 
01231 inline void
01232 GetPot::reset_nominus_cursor()
01233 { nominus_cursor = -1; }
01235 // (*) variables
01236 //.............................................................................
01237 //
01238 inline int
01239 GetPot::operator()(const char* VarName, int Default) const
01240 {
01241     // (*) recording of requested variables happens in '__find_variable()'
01242     const variable*  sv = __find_variable(VarName);
01243     if( sv == 0 ) return Default;
01244     return __convert_to_type(sv->original, Default);
01245 }
01246

01248 GetPot::operator()(const char* VarName, const double& Default) const
01249 {
01250     // (*) recording of requested variables happens in '__find_variable()'
01251     const variable*  sv = __find_variable(VarName);
01252     if( sv == 0 ) return Default;
01253     return __convert_to_type(sv->original, Default);
01254 }

01270     if( sv == 0 ) return Default;

01272     if( element == 0 ) return Default;

01297 
01298 inline void 
01299 GetPot::__record_argument_request(const std::string& Name)
01300 {
01301     if( ! request_recording_f ) return; 
01302 
01303     // (*) record requested variable for later ufo detection
01304     _requested_arguments.push_back(Name);
01305 
01306     // (*) record considered section for ufo detection
01307     STRING_VECTOR      STree = __get_section_tree(Name);
01308     victorate(std::string, STree, it)
01309         if( find(_requested_sections.begin(), _requested_sections.end(), *it) == _requested_sections.end() )
01310             if( section.length() != 0 ) _requested_sections.push_back(*it);
01311 }
01312 
01313 inline void 
01314 GetPot::__record_variable_request(const std::string& Name)
01315 {
01316     if( ! request_recording_f ) return; 
01317 
01318     // (*) record requested variable for later ufo detection
01319     _requested_variables.push_back(Name);
01320 
01321     // (*) record considered section for ufo detection
01322     STRING_VECTOR      STree = __get_section_tree(Name);
01323     victorate(std::string, STree, it)
01324         if( find(_requested_sections.begin(), _requested_sections.end(), *it) == _requested_sections.end() )
01325             if( section.length() != 0 ) _requested_sections.push_back(*it);
01326 }
01327 
01328 // (*) following functions are to be used from 'outside', after getpot has parsed its
01329 //     arguments => append an argument in the argument vector that reflects the addition
01330 inline void
01331 GetPot::__set_variable(const char* VarName, const char* Value)
01332 {
01333     const GetPot::variable* Var = __find_variable(VarName);
01334     if( Var == 0 ) variables.push_back(variable(VarName, Value, _field_separator.c_str()));
01335     else           ((GetPot::variable*)Var)->take(Value, _field_separator.c_str());    
01336 }
01337 
01338 inline void
01339 GetPot::set(const char* VarName, const char* Value, const bool Requested /* = yes */)
01340 {     
01341     const std::string Arg = prefix + std::string(VarName) + std::string("=") + std::string(Value);
01342     argv.push_back(Arg);
01343     __set_variable(VarName, Value);
01344 
01345     // if user does not specify the variable as 'not being requested' it will be 
01346     // considered amongst the requested variables
01347     if( Requested ) __record_variable_request(Arg);
01348 }
01349 
01350 inline void
01351 GetPot::set(const char* VarName, const double& Value, const bool Requested /* = yes */)
01352 { __set_variable(VarName, __double2string(Value).c_str()); }
01353 
01354 inline void 
01355 GetPot::set(const char* VarName, const int Value, const bool Requested /* = yes */)
01356 { __set_variable(VarName, __int2string(Value).c_str()); }

01359 inline unsigned
01360 GetPot::vector_variable_size(const char* VarName) const
01361 {
01362     const variable*  sv = __find_variable(VarName);
01363     if( sv == 0 ) return 0;
01364     return sv->value.size();
01365 }
01366 
01367 inline STRING_VECTOR
01368 GetPot::get_variable_names() const
01369 {
01370     STRING_VECTOR  result;
01371     std::vector<GetPot::variable>::const_iterator it = variables.begin();
01372     for(; it != variables.end(); it++) {
01373         const std::string Tmp = __get_remaining_string((*it).name, prefix);
01374         if( Tmp != "" ) result.push_back(Tmp);
01375     }
01376     return result;
01377 }
01378 
01379 inline STRING_VECTOR
01380 GetPot::get_section_names() const
01381 { return section_list; }
01382 
01383 inline const GetPot::variable*
01384 GetPot::__find_variable(const char* VarName) const
01385 {
01386     const std::string Name = prefix + VarName;
01387 
01388     // (*) record requested variable for later ufo detection
01389     ((GetPot*)this)->__record_variable_request(Name);
01390 
01391     std::vector<variable>::const_iterator it = variables.begin();
01392     for(; it != variables.end(); it++) {
01393         if( (*it).name == Name ) return &(*it);
01394     }
01395     return 0;
01396 }

01399 // (*) ouput (basically for debugging reasons
01400 //.............................................................................
01401 //
01402 inline int
01403 GetPot::print() const
01404 {
01405     std::cout << "argc = " << argv.size() << std::endl;
01406     STRING_VECTOR::const_iterator it = argv.begin();
01407     for(; it != argv.end(); it++)
01408         std::cout << *it << std::endl;
01409     std::cout << std::endl;
01410     return 1;
01411 }
01412 
01413 // (*) dollar bracket expressions (DBEs) ------------------------------------
01414 //
01415 //     1) Entry Function: __DBE_expand_string()
01416 //        Takes a string such as
01417 //
01418 //          "${+ ${x} ${y}}   Subject-${& ${section} ${subsection}}:   ${title}"
01419 //
01420 //        calls __DBE_expand() for each of the expressions
01421 //
01422 //           ${+ ${x} ${y}}
01423 //           ${& ${section} ${subsection}}
01424 //           ${Title}
01425 //
01426 //        and returns the string
01427 //
01428 //          "4711 Subject-1.01:   Mit den Clowns kamen die Schwaene"
01429 //
01430 //        assuming that
01431 //            x          = "4699"
01432 //            y          = "12"
01433 //            section    = "1."
01434 //            subsection = "01"
01435 //            title      = "Mit den Clowns kamen die Schwaene"
01436 //
01437 //      2) __DBE_expand():
01438 //
01439 //           checks for the command, i.e. the 'sign' that follows '${'
01440 //           divides the argument list into sub-expressions using
01441 //           __DBE_get_expr_list()
01442 //
01443 //           ${+ ${x} ${y}}                 -> "${x}"  "${y}"
01444 //           ${& ${section} ${subsection}}  -> "${section}" "${subsection}"
01445 //           ${Title}                       -> Nothing, variable expansion
01446 //
01447 //      3) __DBE_expression_list():
01448 //
01449 //           builds a vector of unbracketed whitespace separated strings, i.e.
01450 //
01451 //           "  ${Number}.a ${: Das Marmorbild} AB-${& Author= ${Eichendorf}-1870}"
01452 //
01453 //           is split into a vector
01454 //
01455 //              [0] ${Number}.a
01456 //              [1] ${: Das Marmorbild}
01457 //              [2] AB-${& Author= ${Eichendorf}}-1870
01458 //
01459 //           Each sub-expression is expanded using expand().
01460 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
01461 inline std::string
01462 GetPot::__DBE_expand_string(const std::string str)
01463 {
01464     // Parses for closing operators '${ }' and expands them letting
01465     // white spaces and other letters as they are.
01466     std::string   new_string = "";
01467     unsigned open_brackets = 0;
01468     unsigned first = 0;
01469     unsigned i = 0;
01470     for(;  i<str.size(); i++) {
01471         if( i < str.size() - 2 && str.substr(i, 2) == "${" ) {
01472             if( open_brackets == 0 ) first = i+2;
01473             open_brackets++;
01474         }
01475         else if( str[i] == '}' && open_brackets > 0) {
01476             open_brackets -= 1;
01477             if( open_brackets == 0 ) {
01478                 const std::string Replacement = __DBE_expand(str.substr(first, i - first));
01479                 new_string += Replacement;
01480             }
01481         }
01482         else if( open_brackets == 0 )
01483             new_string += str[i];
01484     }
01485     return new_string;
01486 }
01487 
01488 inline STRING_VECTOR
01489 GetPot::__DBE_get_expr_list(const std::string str_, const unsigned ExpectedNumber)
01490     // ensures that the resulting vector has the expected number
01491     // of arguments, but they may contain an error message
01492 {
01493     std::string str = str_;
01494     // Separates expressions by non-bracketed whitespaces, expands them
01495     // and puts them into a list.
01496 
01497     unsigned i=0;
01498     // (1) eat initial whitespaces
01499     for(; i < str.size(); i++)
01500         if( ! isspace(str[i]) ) break;
01501 
01502     STRING_VECTOR   expr_list;
01503     unsigned         open_brackets = 0;
01504     std::vector<unsigned> start_idx;
01505     unsigned         start_new_string = i;
01506     unsigned         l = str.size();
01507 
01508     // (2) search for ${ } expressions ...
01509     while( i < l ) {
01510         const char letter = str[i];
01511         // whitespace -> end of expression
01512         if( isspace(letter) && open_brackets == 0) {
01513             expr_list.push_back(str.substr(start_new_string, i - start_new_string));
01514             bool no_breakout_f = true;
01515             for(i++; i < l ; i++) {
01516                 if( ! isspace(str[i]) )
01517                 { no_breakout_f = false; start_new_string = i; break; }
01518             }
01519             if( no_breakout_f ) {
01520                 // end of expression list
01521                 if( expr_list.size() < ExpectedNumber ) {
01522                     const std::string   pre_tmp("<< ${ }: missing arguments>>");
01523                     STRING_VECTOR tmp(ExpectedNumber - expr_list.size(), pre_tmp);
01524                     expr_list.insert(expr_list.end(), tmp.begin(), tmp.end());
01525                 }
01526                 return expr_list;
01527             }
01528         }
01529 
01530         // dollar-bracket expression
01531         if( str.length() >= i+2 && str.substr(i, 2) == "${" ) {
01532             open_brackets++;
01533             start_idx.push_back(i+2);
01534         }
01535         else if( letter == '}' && open_brackets > 0) {
01536             int start = start_idx[start_idx.size()-1];
01537             start_idx.pop_back();
01538             const std::string Replacement = __DBE_expand(str.substr(start, i-start));
01539             if( start - 3 < (int)0)
01540                 str = Replacement + str.substr(i+1);
01541             else
01542                 str = str.substr(0, start-2) + Replacement + str.substr(i+1);
01543             l = str.size();
01544             i = start + Replacement.size() - 3;
01545             open_brackets--;
01546         }
01547         i++;
01548     }
01549 
01550     // end of expression list
01551     expr_list.push_back(str.substr(start_new_string, i-start_new_string));
01552 
01553     if( expr_list.size() < ExpectedNumber ) {
01554         const std::string   pre_tmp("<< ${ }: missing arguments>>");
01555         STRING_VECTOR tmp(ExpectedNumber - expr_list.size(), pre_tmp);
01556         expr_list.insert(expr_list.end(), tmp.begin(), tmp.end());
01557     }
01558 
01559     return expr_list;
01560 }
01561 
01562 inline const GetPot::variable*
01563 GetPot::__DBE_get_variable(std::string VarName)
01564 {
01565     static GetPot::variable ev;
01566     std::string secure_Prefix = prefix;
01567 
01568     prefix = section;
01569     // (1) first search in currently active section
01570     const GetPot::variable* var = __find_variable(VarName.c_str());
01571     if( var != 0 ) { prefix = secure_Prefix; return var; }
01572 
01573     // (2) search in root name space
01574     prefix = "";
01575     var = __find_variable(VarName.c_str());
01576     if( var != 0 ) { prefix = secure_Prefix; return var; }
01577 
01578     prefix = secure_Prefix;
01579 
01580     // error occured => variable name == ""
01581     char* tmp = new char[VarName.length() + 25];
01582 #ifdef WIN32
01583     _snprintf(tmp, (int)sizeof(char)*(VarName.length() + 25), 
01584              "<<${ } variable '%s' undefined>>", VarName.c_str());
01585 #else
01586     snprintf(tmp, (int)sizeof(char)*(VarName.length() + 25), 
01587              "<<${ } variable '%s' undefined>>", VarName.c_str());
01588 #endif
01589     ev.name = "";
01590     ev.original = std::string(tmp);
01591     delete [] tmp;
01592     return &ev;
01593 }
01594 
01595 inline std::string
01596 GetPot::__DBE_expand(const std::string expr)
01597 {
01598     // ${: } pure text
01599     if( expr[0] == ':' )
01600         return expr.substr(1);
01601 
01602     // ${& expr expr ... } text concatination
01603     else if( expr[0] == '&' ) {
01604         const STRING_VECTOR A = __DBE_get_expr_list(expr.substr(1), 1);
01605 
01606         STRING_VECTOR::const_iterator it = A.begin();
01607         std::string result = *it++;
01608         for(; it != A.end(); it++) result += *it;
01609 
01610         return result;
01611     }
01612 
01613     // ${<-> expr expr expr} text replacement
01614     else if( expr.length() >= 3 && expr.substr(0, 3) == "<->" ) {
01615         STRING_VECTOR A = __DBE_get_expr_list(expr.substr(3), 3);
01616         size_t tmp = 0;
01617         const unsigned L = A[1].length();
01618         while( (tmp = A[0].find(A[1])) != std::string::npos ) {
01619             A[0].replace(tmp, L, A[2]);
01620         }
01621         return A[0];
01622     }
01623     // ${+ ...}, ${- ...}, ${* ...}, ${/ ...} expressions
01624     else if( expr[0] == '+' ) {
01625         STRING_VECTOR A = __DBE_get_expr_list(expr.substr(1), 2);
01626         STRING_VECTOR::const_iterator it = A.begin();
01627         double result = __convert_to_type(*it++, 0.0);
01628         for(; it != A.end(); it++)
01629             result += __convert_to_type(*it, 0.0);
01630 
01631         return __double2string(result);
01632     }
01633     else if( expr[0] == '-' ) {
01634         STRING_VECTOR A = __DBE_get_expr_list(expr.substr(1), 2);
01635         STRING_VECTOR::const_iterator it = A.begin();
01636         double result = __convert_to_type(*it++, 0.0);
01637         for(; it != A.end(); it++)
01638             result -= __convert_to_type(*it, 0.0);
01639 
01640         return __double2string(result);
01641     }
01642     else if( expr[0] == '*' ) {
01643         STRING_VECTOR A = __DBE_get_expr_list(expr.substr(1), 2);
01644         STRING_VECTOR::const_iterator it = A.begin();
01645         double result = __convert_to_type(*it++, 0.0);
01646         for(; it != A.end(); it++)
01647             result *= __convert_to_type(*it, 0.0);
01648 
01649         return __double2string(result);
01650     }
01651     else if( expr[0] == '/' ) {
01652         STRING_VECTOR A = __DBE_get_expr_list(expr.substr(1), 2);
01653         STRING_VECTOR::const_iterator it = A.begin();
01654         double result = __convert_to_type(*it++, 0.0);
01655         if( result == 0 ) return "0.0";
01656         for(it++; it != A.end(); it++) {
01657             const double Q = __convert_to_type(*it, 0.0);
01658             if( Q == 0.0 ) return "0.0";
01659             result /= Q;
01660         }
01661         return __double2string(result);
01662     }
01663 
01664     // ${^ ... } power expressions
01665     else if( expr[0] == '^' ) {
01666         STRING_VECTOR A = __DBE_get_expr_list(expr.substr(1), 2);
01667         STRING_VECTOR::const_iterator it = A.begin();
01668         double result = __convert_to_type(*it++, 0.0);
01669         for(; it != A.end(); it++)
01670             result = pow(result, __convert_to_type(*it, 0.0));
01671         return __double2string(result);
01672     }
01673 
01674     // ${==  } ${<=  } ${>= } comparisons (return the number of the first 'match'
01675     else if( expr.length() >= 2 &&
01676              ( expr.substr(0,2) == "==" || expr.substr(0,2) == ">=" ||
01677                expr.substr(0,2) == "<=" || expr[0] == '>'           || expr[0] == '<')) {
01678         // differentiate between two and one sign operators
01679         unsigned op = 0;
01680         enum { EQ, GEQ, LEQ, GT, LT };
01681         if      ( expr.substr(0, 2) == "==" ) op = EQ;
01682         else if ( expr.substr(0, 2) == ">=" ) op = GEQ;
01683         else if ( expr.substr(0, 2) == "<=" ) op = LEQ;
01684         else if ( expr[0] == '>' )            op = GT;
01685         else    /*                     "<" */ op = LT;
01686 
01687         STRING_VECTOR a;
01688         if ( op == GT || op == LT ) a = __DBE_get_expr_list(expr.substr(1), 2);
01689         else                        a = __DBE_get_expr_list(expr.substr(2), 2);
01690 
01691         std::string   x_orig = a[0];
01692         double   x = __convert_to_type(x_orig, 1e37);
01693         unsigned i = 1;
01694 
01695         STRING_VECTOR::const_iterator y_orig = a.begin();
01696         for(y_orig++; y_orig != a.end(); y_orig++) {
01697             double y = __convert_to_type(*y_orig, 1e37);
01698 
01699             // set the strings as reference if one wasn't a number
01700             if ( x == 1e37 || y == 1e37 ) {
01701                 // it's a string comparison
01702                 if( (op == EQ  && x_orig == *y_orig) || (op == GEQ && x_orig >= *y_orig) ||
01703                     (op == LEQ && x_orig <= *y_orig) || (op == GT  && x_orig >  *y_orig) ||
01704                     (op == LT  && x_orig <  *y_orig) )
01705                     return __int2string(i);
01706             }
01707             else {
01708                 // it's a number comparison
01709                 if( (op == EQ  && x == y) || (op == GEQ && x >= y) ||
01710                     (op == LEQ && x <= y) || (op == GT  && x >  y) ||
01711                     (op == LT  && x <  y) )
01712                     return __int2string(i);
01713             }
01714             i++;
01715         }
01716 
01717         // nothing fulfills the condition => return 0
01718         return "0";
01719     }
01720     // ${?? expr expr} select
01721     else if( expr.length() >= 2 && expr.substr(0, 2) == "??" ) {
01722         STRING_VECTOR a = __DBE_get_expr_list(expr.substr(2), 2);
01723         double x = __convert_to_type(a[0], 1e37);
01724         // last element is always the default argument
01725         if( x == 1e37 || x < 0 || x >= a.size() - 1 ) return a[a.size()-1];
01726 
01727         // round x to closest integer
01728         return a[int(x+0.5)];
01729     }
01730     // ${? expr expr expr} if then else conditions
01731     else if( expr[0] == '?' ) {
01732         STRING_VECTOR a = __DBE_get_expr_list(expr.substr(1), 2);
01733         if( __convert_to_type(a[0], 0.0) == 1.0 ) return a[1];
01734         else if( a.size() > 2 ) return a[2];
01735     }
01736     // ${! expr} maxro expansion
01737     else if( expr[0] == '!' ) {
01738         const GetPot::variable* Var = __DBE_get_variable(expr.substr(1));
01739         // error
01740         if( Var->name == "" ) return std::string(Var->original);
01741 
01742         const STRING_VECTOR A = __DBE_get_expr_list(Var->original, 2);
01743         return A[0];
01744     }
01745     // ${@: } - string subscription
01746     else if( expr.length() >= 2 && expr.substr(0,2) == "@:" ) {
01747         const STRING_VECTOR A = __DBE_get_expr_list(expr.substr(2), 2);
01748         double x = __convert_to_type(A[1], 1e37);
01749 
01750         // last element is always the default argument
01751         if( x == 1e37 || x < 0 || x >= A[0].size() - 1)
01752             return "<<1st index out of range>>";
01753 
01754         if( A.size() > 2 ) {
01755             double y = __convert_to_type(A[2], 1e37);
01756             if ( y != 1e37 && y > 0 && y <= A[0].size() - 1 && y > x )
01757                 return A[0].substr(int(x+0.5), int(y+1.5) - int(x+0.5));
01758             else if( y == -1 )
01759                 return A[0].substr(int(x+0.5));
01760             return "<<2nd index out of range>>";
01761         }
01762         else {
01763             char* tmp = new char[2];
01764             tmp[0] = A[0][int(x+0.5)]; tmp[1] = '\0';
01765             std::string result(tmp);
01766             delete [] tmp;
01767             return result;
01768         }
01769     }
01770     // ${@ } - vector subscription
01771     else if( expr[0] == '@' ) {
01772         STRING_VECTOR          A   = __DBE_get_expr_list(expr.substr(1), 2);
01773         const GetPot::variable* Var = __DBE_get_variable(A[0]);
01774         // error
01775         if( Var->name == "" ) {
01776             // make a copy of the string if an error occured
01777             // (since the error variable is a static variable inside get_variable())
01778             return std::string(Var->original);
01779         }
01780 
01781         double x = __convert_to_type(A[1], 1e37);
01782 
01783         // last element is always the default argument
01784         if (x == 1e37 || x < 0 || x >= Var->value.size() )
01785             return "<<1st index out of range>>";
01786 
01787         if ( A.size() > 2) {
01788             double y = __convert_to_type(A[2], 1e37);
01789             int    begin = int(x+0.5);
01790             int    end = 0;
01791             if ( y != 1e37 && y > 0 && y <= Var->value.size() && y > x)
01792                 end = int(y+1.5);
01793             else if( y == -1 )
01794                 end = Var->value.size();
01795             else
01796                 return "<<2nd index out of range>>";
01797 
01798             std::string result = *(Var->get_element(begin));
01799             int i = begin+1;
01800             for(; i < end; i++)
01801                 result += std::string(" ") + *(Var->get_element(i));
01802             return result;
01803         }
01804         else
01805             return *(Var->get_element(int(x+0.5)));
01806     }
01807 
01808     const STRING_VECTOR    A = __DBE_get_expr_list(expr, 1);
01809     const GetPot::variable* B = __DBE_get_variable(A[0]);
01810 
01811     // make a copy of the string if an error occured
01812     // (since the error variable is a static variable inside get_variable())
01813     if( B->name == "" ) return std::string(B->original);
01814     // (psuggs@pobox.com mentioned to me the warning MSVC++6.0 produces
01815     //  with:  else return B->original (thanks))
01816     return B->original;
01817 }

01824 inline bool
01825 GetPot::__search_string_vector(const STRING_VECTOR& VecStr, const std::string& Str) const
01826 {
01827     victorate(std::string, VecStr, itk) {
01828         if( *itk == Str ) return true;
01829     }
01830     return false;
01831 }

01833 inline STRING_VECTOR
01834 GetPot::unidentified_arguments(unsigned Number,
01835                                const char* KnownArgument1, ...) const
01836 {
01837     STRING_VECTOR known_arguments;
01838 
01839     // (1) create a vector of known arguments
01840     if( Number == 0 ) return STRING_VECTOR();
01841 
01842     va_list ap;
01843     va_start(ap, KnownArgument1);
01844     known_arguments.push_back(std::string(KnownArgument1));
01845     unsigned i=1;
01846     for(; i<Number; i++)
01847         known_arguments.push_back(std::string(va_arg(ap, char *)));
01848     va_end(ap);
01849 
01850     return unidentified_arguments(known_arguments);
01851 }

01854 GetPot::unidentified_arguments() const
01855 { return unidentified_arguments(_requested_arguments); }

01857 inline STRING_VECTOR
01858 GetPot::unidentified_arguments(const STRING_VECTOR& Knowns) const
01859 {
01860     STRING_VECTOR ufos;
01861     STRING_VECTOR::const_iterator it = argv.begin();
01862     it++; // forget about argv[0] (application or filename)
01863     for(; it != argv.end(); it++) {
01864         // -- argument belongs to prefixed section ?
01865         const std::string arg = __get_remaining_string(*it, prefix);
01866         if( arg == "" ) continue;
01867 
01868         // -- check if in list
01869         if( __search_string_vector(Knowns, arg) == false)
01870             ufos.push_back(*it);
01871     }
01872     return ufos;
01873 }

01894 
01895 inline STRING_VECTOR
01896 GetPot::unidentified_options() const
01897 { 
01898     // -- every option is an argument. 
01899     // -- the set of requested arguments contains the set of requested options. 
01900     // -- IF the set of requested arguments contains unrequested options, 
01901     //    THEN they were requested as 'follow' and 'next' arguments and not as real options.
01902     //
01903     // => it is not necessary to separate requested options from the list
01904     return unidentified_arguments(_requested_arguments); 
01905 }
01906 
01907 inline STRING_VECTOR
01908 GetPot::unidentified_options(const STRING_VECTOR& Knowns) const
01909 {
01910     STRING_VECTOR ufos;
01911     STRING_VECTOR::const_iterator it = argv.begin();
01912     it++; // forget about argv[0] (application or filename)
01913     for(; it != argv.end(); it++) {
01914         // -- argument belongs to prefixed section ?
01915         const std::string arg = __get_remaining_string(*it, prefix);
01916         if( arg == "" ) continue;
01917 
01918         // is argument really an option (starting with '-') ?
01919         if( arg.length() < 1 || arg[0] != '-' ) continue;
01920 
01921         if( __search_string_vector(Knowns, arg) == false)
01922             ufos.push_back(*it);
01923     }
01924 
01925     return ufos;
01926 }
01927 
01928 inline std::string
01929 GetPot::unidentified_flags(const char* KnownFlagList, int ArgumentNumber=-1) const
01930     // Two modes:
01931     //  ArgumentNumber >= 0 check specific argument
01932     //  ArgumentNumber == -1 check all options starting with one '-'
01933     //                       for flags
01934 {
01935     std::string         ufos;
01936     STRING_VECTOR known_arguments;
01937     std::string         KFL(KnownFlagList);
01938 
01939     // (2) iteration over '-' arguments (options)
01940     if( ArgumentNumber == -1 ) {
01941         STRING_VECTOR::const_iterator it = argv.begin();
01942         it++; // forget about argv[0] (application or filename)
01943         for(; it != argv.end(); it++) {
01944             // -- argument belongs to prefixed section ?
01945             const std::string arg = __get_remaining_string(*it, prefix);
01946             if( arg == "" ) continue;
01947 
01948             // -- does arguments start with '-' (but not '--')
01949             if     ( arg.length() < 2 ) continue;
01950             else if( arg[0] != '-' )    continue;
01951             else if( arg[1] == '-' )    continue;
01952 
01953             // -- check out if flags inside option are contained in KnownFlagList
01954             const char* p=arg.c_str();
01955             p++; // skip starting minus
01956             for(; *p != '\0' ; p++)
01957                 if( KFL.find(*p) == std::string::npos ) ufos += *p;
01958         }
01959     }
01960     // (1) check specific argument
01961     else {
01962         // -- only check arguments that start with prefix
01963         int no_matches = 0;
01964         unsigned i=1;
01965         for(; i<argv.size(); i++) {
01966             const std::string Remain = __get_remaining_string(argv[i], prefix);
01967             if( Remain != "") {
01968                 no_matches++;
01969                 if( no_matches == ArgumentNumber) {
01970                     // -- the right argument number inside the section is found
01971                     // => check it for flags
01972                     const char* p = Remain.c_str();
01973                     p++; // skip starting minus
01974                     for(; *p != '\0' ; p++)
01975                         if( KFL.find(*p) == std::string::npos ) ufos += *p;
01976                     return ufos;
01977                 }
01978             }
01979         }
01980     }
01981     return ufos;
01982 }

01999     va_end(ap);
02000

02004 inline STRING_VECTOR
02005 GetPot::unidentified_variables(const STRING_VECTOR& Knowns) const
02006 {
02007     STRING_VECTOR ufos;
02008 
02009     victorate(GetPot::variable, variables, it) {
02010         // -- check if variable has specific prefix
02011         const std::string var_name = __get_remaining_string((*it).name, prefix);
02012         if( var_name == "" ) continue;
02013 
02014         // -- check if variable is known
02015         if( __search_string_vector(Knowns, var_name) == false)
02016             ufos.push_back((*it).name);
02017     }
02018     return ufos;
02019 }

02026 inline STRING_VECTOR
02027 GetPot::unidentified_sections(unsigned Number,
02028                               const char* KnownSection1, ...) const
02029 {
02030     STRING_VECTOR known_sections;
02031 
02032     // (1) create a vector of known arguments
02033     if( Number == 0 ) return STRING_VECTOR();
02034 
02035     va_list ap;
02036     va_start(ap, KnownSection1);
02037     known_sections.push_back(std::string(KnownSection1));
02038     unsigned i=1;
02039     for(; i<Number; i++) {
02040         std::string tmp = std::string(va_arg(ap, char *));
02041         if( tmp.length() == 0 ) continue;
02042         if( tmp[tmp.length()-1] != '/' ) tmp += '/';
02043         known_sections.push_back(tmp);
02044     }
02045     va_end(ap);
02046 
02047     return unidentified_sections(known_sections);
02048 }

02054 inline STRING_VECTOR
02055 GetPot::unidentified_sections(const STRING_VECTOR& Knowns) const
02056 {

02059     victorate(std::string, section_list, it) {
02060         // -- check if section conform to prefix
02061         const std::string sec_name = __get_remaining_string(*it, prefix);
02062         if( sec_name == "" ) continue;
02063 
02064         // -- check if section is known
02065         if( __search_string_vector(Knowns, sec_name) == false )
02066             ufos.push_back(*it);
02067     }
02068 
02069     return ufos;
02070 }

02073 inline STRING_VECTOR
02074 GetPot::unidentified_nominuses(unsigned Number, const char* Known, ...) const
02075 {
02076     STRING_VECTOR known_nominuses;
02077 
02078     // create vector of known arguments
02079     if( Number == 0 ) return STRING_VECTOR();
02080 
02081     va_list ap;
02082     va_start(ap, Known);
02083     known_nominuses.push_back(std::string(Known));
02084     unsigned i=1;
02085     for(; i<Number; i++) {
02086         std::string tmp = std::string(va_arg(ap, char *));
02087         if( tmp.length() == 0 ) continue;
02088         known_nominuses.push_back(tmp);
02089     }
02090     va_end(ap);
02091 
02092     return unidentified_nominuses(known_nominuses);
02093 }

02095 inline STRING_VECTOR
02096 GetPot::unidentified_nominuses() const {
02097     // -- every nominus is an argument. 
02098     // -- the set of requested arguments contains the set of requested nominuss. 
02099     // -- IF the set of requested arguments contains unrequested nominuss, 
02100     //    THEN they were requested as 'follow' and 'next' arguments and not as real nominuses.
02101     //
02102     // => it is not necessary to separate requested nominus from the list
02103 
02104     return unidentified_nominuses(_requested_arguments);
02105 }
02106 
02107 inline STRING_VECTOR
02108 GetPot::unidentified_nominuses(const STRING_VECTOR& Knowns) const
02109 {
02110     STRING_VECTOR ufos;
02111 
02112     // (2) iterate over all arguments
02113     STRING_VECTOR::const_iterator it = argv.begin();
02114     it++; // forget about argv[0] (application or filename)
02115     for(; it != argv.end(); it++) {
02116         // -- check if nominus part of prefix
02117         const std::string arg = __get_remaining_string(*it, prefix);
02118         if( arg == "" )                                         continue;
02119 
02120         if( arg.length() < 1 )                                  continue;
02121         // option ? --> not a nomius
02122         if( arg[0] == '-' )                                     continue;
02123         // section ? --> not a real nominus
02124         if( arg[0] == '[' && arg[arg.length()-1] == ']' )       continue;
02125         // variable definition ? --> not a real nominus
02126         bool continue_f = false;
02127         unsigned i=0;
02128         for(; i<arg.length() ; i++)
02129             if( arg[i] == '=' ) { continue_f = true; break; }
02130         if( continue_f )                                        continue;
02131 
02132         // real nominuses are compared with the given list
02133         if( __search_string_vector(Knowns, arg) == false )
02134             ufos.push_back(*it);
02135     }
02136     return ufos;
02137 }

02159 inline
02160 GetPot::variable::variable(const char* Name, const char* Value, const char* FieldSeparator)
02161     : name(Name)
02162 {
02163     // make a copy of the 'Value'
02164     take(Value, FieldSeparator);
02165 }
02166 
02167 inline const std::string*
02168 GetPot::variable::get_element(unsigned Idx) const
02169 { if( Idx >= value.size() ) return 0; else return &(value[Idx]); }
02170 
02171 inline void
02172 GetPot::variable::take(const char* Value, const char* FieldSeparator)
02173 {
02174     original = std::string(Value);
02175 
02176     // separate string by white space delimiters using 'strtok'
02177     // thread safe usage of strtok (no static members)
02178     char* spt = 0;
02179     // make a copy of the 'Value'
02180     char* copy = new char[strlen(Value)+1];
02181     strcpy(copy, Value);
02182     char* follow_token = strtok_r(copy, FieldSeparator, &spt);
02183     if( value.size() != 0 ) value.erase(value.begin(), value.end());
02184     while(follow_token != 0) {
02185         value.push_back(std::string(follow_token));
02186         follow_token = strtok_r(NULL, FieldSeparator, &spt);
02187     }
02188 
02189     delete [] copy;
02190 }
02191 
02192 inline
02193 GetPot::variable::~variable()
02194 {}
02195 
02196 inline GetPot::variable&
02197 GetPot::variable::operator=(const GetPot::variable& That)
02198 {
02199     if( &That != this) {
02200         name     = That.name;
02201         value    = That.value;
02202         original = That.original;
02203     }
02204     return *this;
02205 }
